comment: My goat. Very well structured and easy to understand class. Decent bit of homework but it's important to reinforce the material learned. As long as you pay attention and do the homework you'll be breezing.

The professor teaches each concept so well and explains why. Attendance is not mandatory but there is usually a quiz on the last class of the week. The quizzes are just one question over an easy concept he taught and he gives a lot of partial credit. The study guide is just the exam with different numbers so its really helpful
rating_tags: Amazing lectures --Clear grading criteria--Gives good feedback

comment: Also had for 2335, class was fairly easy. Weekly quizzes that were trivial in difficulty. WebAssign is the key to the whole class. The only downside is you don't feel like you actually learned anything, you just go through the motions
rating_tags: Clear grading criteria--Accessible outside class--Online Savvy

comment: Lectures aren't the best because of his accent, but he's really nice. Doesn't explain concepts well in my opinion and his lecture slides are useless. Homework is 40% so that helps.

Amazing professor, super easy class and literally spoon feeds you the content. He is quite generous with grading and very explicit as what to expect on any quizzes or tests. His study guides are very very very helpful.

above average professor. Relates many topics to CS concepts which makes the class feel more useful. lots of hw but it is worth 40% so it's a fair trade. Cares about students and explains topics well. Overall excellent professor. weekly quizzes so attendance is not "mandatory" but basically is.Tests have the same style questions as quiz so arnt hard
rating_tags: Clear grading criteria--Lots of homework--Lecture heavy

comment: Took him for MATH 3260, he made this class extremely easy whilst also teaching you the actual material. Homework is 40% so if you just get an A on your homework, you're sitting pretty. Also, for his two tests I got perfect scores because he gives you a practice exam with the exact problems but just different numbers before the test. Easy A.

Nice person and his accent isn't deal-breaking. He goes really fast,  but you could partially blame the difficulty of the content making it seem faster than it really is. He claims everything is super easy which gets annoying when you're confused but besides that overall decent.HW is worth 40% so that helps a lot. attendance not req; weekly quizzes

Very good math professor. He provided lots of materials to do well in the class. Attendance is not mandatory, but he gives weekly quizzes that will damage your grade a lot if you miss them. Doesn't take points off for messing up the arithmetic as long as you show you know how to solve the problem.
rating_tags: Participation matters--Clear grading criteria--Lots of homework

comment: Took him for MATH 2306. Kind of hard to understand with his accent and somewhat poor lectures, thankfully there are other resources for math. Tests and quizzes are comically easy due to them being pulled straight from the homework.

Like the previous user stated this Professor lacks empathy and ethics and is unnecessarily harsh. During a pandemics when millions of people were dying daily, I was impacted as my father was potentially one of those people. While in and out of the hospital, I missed a few homeworks and asked for an extension which he responded he didnt care & no.

This professor is unnecessarily harsh. His lectures are way too fast and he doesn't give enough time on the tests so unless you're a genius you may not finish in time. He doesn't give extra credit but he gives a lot of unnecessary homework. He's not the worst math teacher I've taken but to save myself the stress, I wouldn't take him again.
rating_tags: Beware of pop quizzes--Lecture heavy--Tough grader

comment: He covered the material in a clear+digestable manner. A lot of work in the class is computational grunt work, so be warned. Some of the content in the first half of the semester felt trivial and slow, but that is really the class not him. He also takes attendance, be sure to show up. He had bit of an accent but not too bad. Overall, Good Professor.
